meanings.definition: To make twice as great or intense.
meanings.sent1: She decided to redouble her efforts to finish the project on time.
meanings.sent2: The storm redoubled in strength, causing widespread damage.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to redouble the amount of spices in the recipe, making it extra flavorful.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the colors in the sky redoubled, creating a breathtaking view.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's praise only served to redouble the student's determination to succeed.

meanings.definition: To repeat or increase in intensity.
meanings.sent1: The applause began to redouble as the performer took the stage.
meanings.sent2: His efforts to learn the new skill only redoubled after each setback.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes were so funny that they caused the audience to redouble with laughter.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the drums redoubled, signaling the start of the parade.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in the room redoubled as the surprise guest entered.

meanings.definition: To become twice as great or intense.
meanings.sent1: The heat in the room redoubled as more people entered.
meanings.sent2: Her joy redoubled when she received the good news.
meanings.sent3: The suspense in the movie redoubled as the plot thickened.
meanings.sent4: The tension between the two characters redoubled with each passing scene.
meanings.sent5: The music's tempo redoubled, filling the room with energy.
